processors.name: Set filename and mime type attributes

properties.Replacement Value:
You are an insurance claim processor. Read the following letter from an insurance customer and extract the requestor name, the requestor email, the date of the request, the policy number, the insurance plan name, and the reimbursement amount. Format the output as shown in the example.

Example Input:
$1

Example Output:
name: Mike Hawthorne
email: hawm1234@gmail.com
date: September 28, 2023
policy number: 175032218
insurance plan name: SpecialDentalPlus
reimbursement amount: $540.25

Input:


Output:
properties.Text to Prepend:
Please provide a summary of the following text. Do not add any information that is not mentioned in the text below.

Input:

properties.Attributes List: model_id, created_at, generated_text, generated_token_count, input_token_count, filename, inputs, invokehttp.request.url, s3.bucket

Max Length To Put In Attribute.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute
Max Length To Put In Attribute

source.name: Set filename and mime type attributes

destination.name: Set filename and mime type attributes

labels.label:
Prep Model Input: This processor uses the parameter 
"watsonx Model Input". Make sure you have entered your 
IBM Project ID as part of the parameter's value.

The default LLM is "ibm/granite-13b-chat-v1", but the LLM 
and its attributes can be changed via the parameter.

Add Instructions: Provide custom instructions to output a summary of
the text data.
Get IAM token from IBM using your API Key
List S3: This processor retrieves a listing of the text files from S3.
These processors prepare the input data for the model.

s3.path attribute & Set S3 Path:
These processors set the S3 path
 of the target destination.

Write To S3: This processor writes the summary data files to the specified
target destination S3 bucket.
Call Model: This processor invokes the watsonx.ai model.

Define a KPI on this connection to monitor 
failed S3 write operations.
Fetch S3: This processor retrieves the text files from S3.

These processors take the model's output and convert it into simple 
JSON structure.

This flow consumes text data from a source S3 location and
invokes a large language model in IBM watsonx.ai to summarize 
the input data. The response from the model is written as text to a 
destination S3 location.

To trigger the flow, create a sample text file "forest.txt" (with the following content) and upload it to your source S3 location:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A forest is an area of land dominated by trees. Hundreds of definitions of forest are used throughout the world, incorporating factors 
such as tree density, tree height, land use, legal standing, and ecological function. The United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) 
defines a forest as, Land spanning more than 0.5 hectares with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of more than 10 percent, 
or trees able to reach these thresholds in situ. It does not include land that is predominantly under agricultural or urban use.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

parameters.name: CDP Workload User Password
parameters.description: Specify the password of the CDP machine user or workload user you're using to authenticate against the object stores.

parameters.name: CDP Workload User
parameters.description: Specify the CDP machine user or workload username that you want to use to authenticate to the object stores.  Ensure this user has the appropriate access rights to the object store locations in Ranger or IDBroker.

parameters.name: Destination S3 Bucket
watsonx Model Input
parameters.description:
Specify the model input body in JSON format. You must enter your IBM project ID. The default  LLM model used is "ibm/granite-13b-chat-v1". 

Do not modify "input" attribute. Update other attributes as necessary.

parameters.name: Source S3 Bucket
parameters.description: Specify the name of the source S3 bucket you want to read from.

parameters.name: watsonx Model URL
parameters.description: Specify the IBM watsonx model URL. The default value is "https://us-south.ml.cloud.ibm.com/ml/v1-beta/generation/text?version=2023-05-29".

parameters.name: IBM Cloud API Key
parameters.description: Specify the IBM Cloud API Key needed for the IAM token request.

parameters.name: Destination S3 Path
Source S3 Path
parameters.description: Specify the path within the source bucket where you want to read files from.
